page.title: 19"Bowcombe"-Population.
page.content: {"Most of the people here now are {complete strangers to me."}This remark by one resident of more than 50 years reflects a sentiment expressed by several older inhabitants, and underlines the social changes resulting from the profound changes in farming describe elsewhere. In addition to the few remaining farm workers and two gamekeepers, the population includes an agricultural engineer who came to the Island 30 years ago when his parents retired here, a couple who retired from Huddersfield 16 years ago to live next door to their gamekeeper son, a retired bus driver, and two girls who share a rented cottage; one working in an Estate Agents in Newport, and the other working in a bank in Cowes.{"I {left home because I felt it was time {to. I still get on with my parents."}
